Case reference: 2014004010.CaseDesc: On September 16, 1993, Howard Metacat was last seen in Indian Cabins, Alberta. Howard was hunting alone along the Hay River, 6 miles north of Indian Cabins and wandered away from his campsite in the early morning hours of September 17, 1993.

Scar: Neck, 2 inches on the right side

Case reference: 2014005716.CaseDesc: Maria MARIN left her personal belongings at Johnsons Lake near Wasa, British Columbia and was never seen again.

Case reference: 2008007698.CaseDesc: John McColl left a note at his parent's home on January 27, 1979 stating that he was travelling to Nassau, Bahamas via the United States. He is known to have visited with friends in London, Ontario at the beginning of December, 1979.  Also, he purchased an airline ticket on December 14, 1979 in San Francisco. Family had noted that Mr. McColl was depressed at the time.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Middle Finger, previous break from injury/trauma

Case reference: 2018045881.CaseDesc: In July of 2018 Tatianna Cuevas was taken on vacation by her father John Varga from Toronto, Ontario to Paris, France. It is the belief that she was abducted by her father as they have not returned to Canada on the agreed upon date.

Case reference: 2014004614.CaseDesc: Jacob Miller has gone missing in the past, however he has always returned. Mr. Miller was last seen in Winnipeg, MB going for a walk carrying a green backpack and appearing quite disheveled.

Case reference: 2014004973.CaseDesc: Luke Retieff was last seen by his mother at his residence on July 21, 2007. He had been prescribed numerous medications for his medical conditions. He was despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Hair: Brown, Short, Wavy, Light brown goatee
Boots: Leather, Brown, hiking boots, shoe size 9 - 10
Coat: Nylon, Red, Ski jacket with black and white stripes on arms

Case reference: 2019038949.CaseDesc: On May 8, 2019, Calvin Brown was last seen at his home in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Calvin boarded a flight to Jamaica and was scheduled to return on May 20, but has not returned home.

Case reference: 2016067449.CaseDesc: Jennifer Hillier-Penney was last seen in St. Anthony, NL on November 30, 2016.  It is believed that she went missing around 8:00 pm that evening from a residence in that community. Her personal belongings, including her cell phone, purse, shoes and jacket were left behind.

Tattoo: Capricorn sign on wrist, unsure of which wrist
Right Chest, eye of horus on the right rib
Scar: on knee from surgery, unsure which knee

Case reference: 2006024199.CaseDesc: Diane Cudmore was last seen on February 22, 1972, before she wandered away from her home. Diane was known to have mental health issues that may have played a part in her disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003550.CaseDesc: Kenneth James Schmit, who went by "Jimmy", was last seen leaving a social gathering at a home in St. Walburg, SK, at 10:30 p.m. on September 22, 1966. Mr. Schmit was despondent, and, at the time of his disappearance, had a heavy beard. Numerous searches of the area were conducted, however, Mr. Schmit was not located.

Case reference: 2014001079.CaseDesc: On June 5, 1986, the skeletal remains of an unidentified man, believed to be between the ages of 18-29, were found in a wooded area near Hollyburn Mountain in Cypress Provincial Park in West Vancouver British-Columbia. He was likely not from the region and may have went missing between 1984 and 1985. He carried a small figure of Jurojin, an ancient Japanese god of fortune, and had a photo of the Buddha in his wallet. He would be about 60 years old today.

Jacket: Grey, HOODED, Hooded with front zipper

Case reference: 2014005193.CaseDesc: Margaret Schwabe was last seen at her home in East St. Paul, Manitoba. She has not been seen since.

Hair: Grey, Wavy, Short, Hair was dyed dark brown with a red undertone
Teeth: Full upper dentures and a partial dental plate on lower jaw

Case reference: 1989125890.CaseDesc: Jeffrey was taken by a couple driving a 1979-80 blue chevy truck.

Case reference: 2014002578.CaseDesc: On November 15, 1979, Martin Corbet was seen for the last time as he went hunting in the woods.

Hat: Wool, Yellow, Toque; Yellow, Black, Orange

Case reference: 2014002608.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1998, Jong Donohue was seen for the last time as he departed from Camrose, Alberta. It is possible that Jong may have had plans to travel to Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2016068405.CaseDesc: On March 29, 1970, the remains of a male were found on the Lake Erie shore in Point Pelee National Park. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 180lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. It is estimated that he had been in the water for approximately 1 week to 6 months prior to discovery.

Case reference: 2014004819.CaseDesc: Reginald Andrew FLETT (known as Reggie) was last seen walking around downtown Thompson, Manitoba shortly before his disappearance on either September 16th or 17th, 2007. FLETT had also been spotted earlier near both the Thompson Walmart and the Extra Foods. He was reported as missing by a family member on September 19, 2006.   Shortly thereafter, family members from Split Lake, Manitoba conducted searches around both Split Lake and Thompson, both of which failed to uncover any trace of FLETT. Thereafter, missing persons posters were distributed throughout Thompson. Although FLETT's whereabouts remain unknown, the investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014003046.CaseDesc: Yu Lowe was last seen on February 15, 1984 when he left his home in Vancouver, British Columbia. Mr. Lowe said he was going to the movies and never came back.

Case reference: 2013000114.CaseDesc: Abigail Andrews, a single Metis woman, lived in a basement suite in Fort St. John. She worked at FSJ Fashions, and The Frontier Bar and Grill. She was pregnant but not yet showing. Abigail was last seen on the evening of April 7, 2010 walking from her home towards a friend's house.

Teeth: Good, Used a dental pallet retainer
Deformity: Right Index Finger, Previously broken and healed in a deformed position

Case reference: 2012020044.CaseDesc: Rodney Sloat was last seen by friends, while having dinner at their residence. His friend indicated that he was despondent when he left on his snowmobile at around midnight. He was invited to spend Christmas with his friends, but did not go. Mr. Sloat was reported missing by his family several days later. His snowmobile, all of his possessions, and his identification were found at his home.

Case reference: 2014001441.CaseDesc: On April 28, 1972, James Cordell was seen for the last time leaving his parents’ residence in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, James was driving a 1970 silver blue Dodge Polar vehicle.  He had a cast on his right arm and his teeth were wired shut as a result of a motor vehicle collision.

Shirt: Purple, Lavender, Mauve, White, SHRT SLEEV, Mauve and white terrycloth short sleeve

Case reference: 2016008425.CaseDesc: Colleen Sylvia Smith was last seen at home, on February 9, 2016, by her ex-boyfriend/landlord.

Case reference: 2013000075.CaseDesc: On December 15, 1988, Jean Berthiaume was seen for the last time in the Mount Royal area of Montreal, Quebec. Jean's vehicle was located at the Dorval Airport in Montreal, Quebec. No one has seen or heard from him since.

Deformity: Right Arm, Smaller than the left
Scar: Right Upper Arm , "U" shape above the elbow

Case reference: 2020011471.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1975, at approximately 9:00 am, Stella Zayats was last seen by her husband as she left her residence to go for a walk in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2007004899.CaseDesc: James Gordon MacDonald was last seen by his father on October 23, 1980 in Sault Ste. Marie, Ontario. An extensive investigation by the Sault Ste Marie Police Service was conducted but to this date Mr. MacDonald has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2005005399.CaseDesc: On April 15, 1993, the body of an unidentified man was found on the shore of Lake Ontario, near the intersection of Maplegrove Road and Lakeshore Road in Lincoln.  His post-mortem weight was recorded as being  174lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Amalgam fillings in his lower molars

Case reference: 2013000053.CaseDesc: On October 20 2010, OPP were called to the Iroquois Locks, Iroquois ON by the Captain of a Bulk Laker reporting that crew member Gary Charlton had not shown up for his noon shift.  Crew members and the OPP conducted searches of the vessel without locating Charlton.  He was last seen on the vessel by crew members at 4:10 a.m., October 20, 2010 when the vessel was in Lake Ontario in the Cobourg area.

Case reference: 2014003393.CaseDesc: James Siwy's last confirmed contact with his family was in 1982 in the Drumheller, Alberta area.  Shortly after that, he left Alberta for Ontario with some friends.  They were traveling in Mr. Siwy's 1975 white Dodge 4 door Monaco that had a burgundy roof.  His family never heard from him again.  In 1984 Mr. Siwy's Monaco was found abandoned in Ontario and there were unconfirmed reports that he may have been hitchhiking in northern Ontario.  Mr. Siwy was reported missing by his family in 1994 when they tried to notify him of the death of a family member.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, parted in the middle

Case reference: 2014002896.CaseDesc: On October 25, 1981, at around 10:00pm, Madeleine Thibault was seen for the last time on Commercial Road in Lévis, Québec. While leaving her house, Madeleine mentioned that she was going to her mother's for a visit.

Jewelry: Gold, COLLIER, Chain with two hearts
Mark: Mouth, Beauty mark on the left side

Case reference: 2006022599.CaseDesc: Edwin Scherer was last seen while on a hunting trip at Cedar Point Lodge on Gordon Lake. He was on vacation at the time and was a resident of Wisconsin, U.S.A.

Shirt: Wool, White, Black, lumberjack style; dirty
Jewelry: Gold, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, watch with 3 black stones
Gold, Blue, Ring, large blue stone
Vest: Brown, Orange, hunting vest with orange on the shoulders

Case reference: 2008019699.CaseDesc: On April 10, 2006 Mohmud Jiwani left his residence in Oakville to attend a business meeting in Toronto. He never returned to his Oakville residence. His vehicle was later located in the Jarvis and Dundas area of Toronto. Despite an extensive investigation, no further information has been uncovered regarding his disappearance.

Pants: Dark Blue, Navy blue suit pants

Case reference: 2020011793.CaseDesc: On October 23, 1985, Ruth Koenig was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Ruth had taken some time off from working following the death of her husband on October 18, but never returned.

Case reference: 2010000899.CaseDesc: Wilfred Bruder was last spoken to on February 28th, 2004 while talking on a pay phone at the Willow West Mall in Guelph. This mall is adjacent to the Hanlon Expressway (Hwy 6) that runs north/south through the west end of Guelph. He was depressed and said his goodbyes to his ex-wife and children.  He had a history of depression and alcholism and was drinking heavily at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014002557.CaseDesc:
On April 17, 2000, Craig Snider left his family's place in Coquitlam to go to work as a commercial fisherman at Stevenson Marina in Richmond, British Columbia and has never been seen or heard from since. 
Mr Snider commuted regularly from Port Alberni, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014002445.CaseDesc: On April 9, 1998, Elaine Dumba was reported missing from Coquitlam, British Columbia. However, Ms. Dumba’s family have not seen or heard from her since April 9, 1989.

Case reference: 2014002598.CaseDesc: Tina Fang Chen arrived in Canada from China in May 2000 and stayed in Mississauga Ontario for approximately 3 weeks, until her disappearance on June 9, 2000.  It is believed that she had the intention to enter the USA and was possibly headed for New York State.

Case reference: 2021000674.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Tyler Desorcy was seen for the last time in the 900 block of Pandora Avenue in Victoria, British Columbia. Tyler has no fixed address and he has not been seen or heard from by his family, which is out of character for him.  Tyler is known to walk with a notable limp.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown receeding hair with some facial hair

Case reference: 2017060723.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2017, Amber Barlow was last seen in the area of 107 Street and 152 Avenue, Edmonton. Early the following morning, Amber made a post on social media, which she constantly used to communicate with family and friends. Her social media account had no further activity after this time. It is unknown when she left her residence, what she was last wearing or how she may have left. Amber did not have access to a vehicle and would typically use public transit to get around. She lived a high risk lifestyle and seemed despondent on the night she was last seen.

Case reference: 2014002895.CaseDesc: Pierre Merasty grew up in the Lynn Lake area of MB and resided there until November of 1994 when he moved to Winnipeg, MB.  He lived with family and friends for a while prior to moving into a house in the downtown area of Winnipeg.  After he moved, he was never heard from again.  Mr. Merasty was known to frequent the Main Street bars and would usually walk anywhere he had to go.

Case reference: 2014005110.CaseDesc: On June 3, 2008, at approximately 9:25 p.m., Jaquelyn Latto was seen for the last time as she left the Juliette Place Shelter in Toronto, Ontario. Jaquelyn had told the staff at the shelter that she was going out with her brother.

Case reference: 2012020017.CaseDesc: Stephen Begg was reported missing February 16, 2011.  Mr. Begg struggled with alcoholism and depression.

Case reference: 2014004580.CaseDesc: On the morning of the 23rd of July 1991, a group of 8 individuals left Igloolik NU. heading to Hall Beach, NU.  The group travelled using a 24 feet freighter canoe powered by a 30 hp outboard.  It was a stormy day with heavy rain.  Approximately 15 miles North of Hall Beach, the canoe hit ice, filled with water and capsized.  Only one occupant made it back to shore.

Case reference: 2008015599.CaseDesc: In late February 2006 William "Billy" Mason of Hamilton Ontario went missing. An extensive investigation has been conducted by the Hamilton Police Service but William Mason has not been seen or heard from since.  It is known that Billy Mason was murdered shortly after he went missing. The responsible person was convicted of his killing but Billy Mason's remains have not been recovered.

Case reference: 2005006499.CaseDesc:
On December 17, 1977, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of Lake Ontario near Long Branch Park, Toronto. Anthropological analysis suggests that he may be Hispanic. 
His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.
It is believed that he had been dead for at least one year prior to his discovery.

Teeth: Stained, Several dental fillings and a number of teeth were lost/extracted prior to death. Staining suggest he may have been a smoker.
Jewelry: Brown, Wide brown band on his left wrist, possibly a watch.

Case reference: 2014002841.CaseDesc: Michel Gagné was last seen on June 29, 1982, in Montreal, QC. Mr. Gagné left his friend's mother's home to go with him to a medical clinic. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020006272.CaseDesc: On October 27, 1962, at approximately midnight, Francis Tan was last seen leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario. Francis had left his home with two other men.

Coat: Dark Blue, Blazer, McGill University crest on the pocket

Case reference: 2020008580.CaseDesc: On December 14, 1973, at approximately 8:30 am, Teresa Desa was seen for the last time at her family home in Toronto, Ontario. There is a possibility that Teresa ran away with the family’s tenant, Amavel Santos.

Coat: Brown, Light brown with white trim

Case reference: 2012020659.CaseDesc: Brandy Wesaquate was last seen leaving a house party in the 900 block of Rae Street, Regina, Saskatchewan, at approximately 01:30 hours on January 1, 2012.  Brandy has not had any contact with family or friends since the date of her disappearance.

Jacket: White, Black, Adidas brand, blue or black stripes down the sleeves

Case reference: 2014006256.CaseDesc: Christopher Maier resides in Saskatoon and came to Regina to visit family and friends in December 1994. It was assumed that Mr. Maier went back to Saskatoon, however, this information was not confirmed. Mr. Maier has not been seen since and was reported missing to the Regina Police Service on September 18, 2013.

Scar: Forehead, The scar was L shaped. No actual size of the scar is available.
Pierce: Ears, He had one piercing in his right ear.

Case reference: 2014002300.CaseDesc: Steven Thomas MacLaren was reported missing when he failed to show up at work on July  11, 1981.  When last spoken to, he had planned on going hiking in Kananaskis Provincial Park. It is believed he was last seen on June 29, 1981.

Case reference: 2020040979.CaseDesc: On September 6, 2020, François Danford-Dussault was seen for the last time by his family in Gatineau, Quebec. François is known to be a solitary man who speaks French and English and travels by foot or bicycle. It is believed he may have travelled to British Columbia.

Case reference: 2006020699.CaseDesc: Frank Turtle was last seen on May 12, 1994 at South Camp on Peishk Lake, near Red Lake, Ontario. His boat was found but Mr. Turtle was never found.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2016068333.CaseDesc: This left humerus (upper arm bone) was located in approximately 47 feet of water and 19 minutes from the shore in the Niagara River, approximately 1 km north of East/West Line in Niagara-on-the-Lake. Dive teams failed to locate any further remains. The bone is from a male, possibly black. The remains have been in the water for an extended period of time (5 to 25 years).

Case reference: 2015011639.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1986, the body of an adult male believed to be between the ages of 30-40, was found in the waters of Pier 2 of the La Ronde marina on St. Helen’s Island in Montreal, Quebec.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teething is natural with dentistry work. He could have had two partial dentures.
Sweater: White, Blue, T-shirt with blue sleeves

Case reference: 2020011959.CaseDesc: On May 4, 1986, James Masten, Patricia Heys, Mark Smith, and Kimberly Masten were seen for the last time as they left Bluffer’s Park in Toronto, Ontario, on a 16-foot boat. The four were heading out onto Lake Ontario.

Scar: Right Eye, 2 inch scar over right eye

Case reference: 2016031589.CaseDesc: On September 20, 1978, a male was witnessed to jump in front of the subway train at Sherbourne Station in Toronto. His post-mortem length was measured at 5'11", however, this measurement may not represent his actual height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix is present.

Hair: Brown, Short, Dark brown hair and a few days growth of facial hair.
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Blue, Ingraham, had a blue dial and indicated the date.
Ring: Gold, band on his left middle finger

Case reference: 2013000028.CaseDesc: Leonette Purcell has not been seen or heard from since she disappeared on December 16, 2004, from her Grand Lake home situated near the Halifax International Airport. The circumstances of Mrs. Purcell's disappearance are suspicious and foul play is suspected.

Case reference: 2014005768.CaseDesc: On March 16, 2012, Sol Han was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Sol did not show up for school.

Case reference: 2014004849.CaseDesc: In the evening of November 21, 2006, Yves Castonguay left his residence in Bécancour, Gentilly sector. He may have been spotted a few times; however Mr. Castonguay has had no contact with his family since this date. His family have reason to fear for his health and safety.

Case reference: 2014004217.CaseDesc: On May 7, 1968, Bernice Redhead, her brother and their parents were on the back of a dogsled which was being led by their grandfather. The group was traveling on God's River when they broke through the ice. All passengers fell into the water.   The grandfather was able to pull everyone to safety with the exception of Bernice, who was taken away by the swift moving current of the river. Bernice has not been located.

Case reference: 2014005589.CaseDesc: On May 1, 1971, Lillian Giroux was seen for the last time when she was left with relatives in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2020024716.CaseDesc: In August 1975, David Bleaney was seen for the last time in Charleston, West Virginia, in the United States. David was born in Ontario, Canada but had moved to the United States. David failed to show up for a court ordered appearance to answer to charges of arson in Charleston. David’s family suspect that he fled back to Canada.

Case reference: 2020032400.CaseDesc: On April 1, 2019, Samantha Hiebert was seen for the last time by her friends and family in the area of Powerview-Pine Falls, Manitoba. During the time of her disappearance, Samantha had been seen at the Sagkeeng Employment and Income Assistance Office.

Case reference: 2014005617.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1995, Bradley Wiesner was on an island in Manitou Lake, Saskatchewan, in the company of other individuals. He was seen for the last time at approximately 8:00 pm when he was swimming towards the boat they were using as it had started to float away from shore.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Necklace with a silver ring on it
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, Wylie Coyote holding a beer mug

Case reference: 2014001538.CaseDesc: During the month of March, 1998, Theresa Johnny was seen for the last time in Whitehorse, Yukon. The last known contact with Theresa was on July 18, 1998, with the Anchorage Police Department in Alaska, United States. Over the years, there have been a number of unconfirmed tips received about Theresa’s location and well being.

Case reference: 2006026499.CaseDesc: Simon McDonald was last seen on May 9, 2001, leaving his daughter's residence on the White Dog, First Nations Territory. He was known to enjoy walking along the river. Extensive searches of the area have failed to locate Mr. McDonald.

Hair: Black, Grey, Unkempt; Beard, Moustache, Sideburns
Shoes: Cloth, Red, Black, slippers with leather soles.

Case reference: 2021017400.CaseDesc: On April 24, 2021, at approximately 12:15 a.m., Saniyya Dennis was seen for the last time on the pedestrian bridge leading to Goat Island in Niagara Falls, New York. Saniyya sent a last text message at 1:23 a.m., from the Goat Island and Luna Island area.

Shoes: Black, White, Black and white check "VANS" shoes
Sweater: Black, HOODIE, White lettering on the left side of chest and across the back
Hat: Black, KNIT, White lettering on the brim

Case reference: 2014001462.CaseDesc: Gareth Austin was last seen on August 17, 1995, and was last known to be in Medicine Hat, Alberta with Dominic Park.

Scar: Left Hand, Scar top of left hand

Case reference: 2014005713.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1980, Michael Konopekly was seen for the last time when he went fishing on Pallet Lake, near Cochrane, Ontario. Mr. Konopekly’s canoe, paddle and fishing rod were located at the lake, but Mr. Konopekly was not located.

Case reference: 2016066675.CaseDesc: On June 2, 1970, skeletal remains were located 125 km west of Thunder Bay on Highway #17. Shoes, socks and a coat were also located in the area.

Case reference: 2014000002.CaseDesc: Dennis Bastillo was living with his family at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen near the Lions Gate Bridge between Vancouver and West Vancouver, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2014003424.CaseDesc: On December 5, 1992, Marie Trahan was last seen in Petit-Shippagan, New Brunswick.  Marie's abandoned vehicle was later located at the wharf.

Case reference: 2022011021.CaseDesc: On March 17, 2022, Nicholas Adamson was seen for the last time walking away from an establishment in the area of Sullivan Avenue and Front Street South in Thorold, Ontario.

Shirt: White, BUTTON UP, Short sleeve button up
Tattoo: Left Chest, Head of a wolf

Case reference: 2014005701.CaseDesc: On November 11, 2011, at approximately 7:00 a.m., Dezso Junaszka was seen for the last time as he left his residence to go to work in Toronto, Ontario.

Coat: Denim, Blue, Brown, Large white logo on the back and left breast "UNK"
Shoes: White, Running, Running shoes; possibly "Puma" brand

Case reference: 2019035278.CaseDesc: On August 21, 1982, the remains of a male were found on the banks of Bouchard Island, near Saint-Sulpice, Quebec.

Coat: Leather, Black, Three-quarters with fur collar

Case reference: 2019007309.CaseDesc: On December 12, 2018, Robert Campbell was seen for the last time as he left work in Toronto, Ontario. Robert had not been seen for three months before he was reported missing.

Case reference: 2014005152.CaseDesc: Anker Ljunggren was a farm hand who worked in Yellow Grass, SK. Ljunggren was last seen in October, 1935, by his wife. He was working in Craik or Craven, SK but was heading north to find more work and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2014002145.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1975, Mr. Garson with his father, brother and a friend set out for Moose Lake to hunt. On September 14, other hunters found gas cans, and a thermos with the name of Garson on it. These hunters reported their findings to police.  A search was initiated and police found a boat submerged upright on the bottom of the lake. The depth of the lake around the boat was only 8 to 10 feet deep. It appeared to Police that the men encountered extremely rough water while crossing Moose Lake. The motors were both found to be in forward gear. There was no floatation gear in the boat and it was heavily loaded with camping and hunting equipment. All of the bodies were recovered with the exception of M. Garson. It is presumed Mr. Garson drowned.

Case reference: 2014004672.CaseDesc: On the 13th of June, 1995, Marcel Legris and a friend were last seen fishing on Cold Lake, SK. A large storm suddenly came up and it is believed swamped the boat they were using. The friend’s body was located, however, Mr. Legris was never found.

Case reference: 2008006699.CaseDesc: On June 18, 1967, Stanley Sczcygiel was fishing on the Berens River with two other Americans.  All three were swept over the falls.  The other two men survived, however Mr. Sczcygiel is presumed to have drowned.  His body has never been recovered.

Case reference: 2018063020.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1997, Donghui Zhao was last heard from when he spoke with his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Donghui had not been seen or heard from for three months before his disappearance was reported.

Case reference: 2014005439.CaseDesc: John Sparrow was last seen in April or May of 2001, getting into an early 1990s black Chevrolet pick-up truck while accompanied by an unknown male driver. Mr. Sparrow and the unknown man left the parking lot of the Denny's restaurant located at Benson Ave and Division St, in the city of Kingston, Ontario and headed north past highway #401.

Case reference: 2014002936.CaseDesc: On February 3, 1988, David Ambroise, then 3 years old, was playing near the Saint-Maurice River in the First Nations reserve of Wemotaci. David approached too close to the water, slipped and fell in. He was then swept away by the current, and has never been found despite searches.

Case reference: 2014002762.CaseDesc: On March 3rd, 1982, Laurence Peterson and Randolph Johanson were reported missing by Mr. Johanson’s girlfriend. Mr. Johanson and Mr. Peterson were last seen on February 28th, 1982, leaving the Shelter Island Marina, on their boats. Mr. Johanson was reportedly using his 26 ft. long salvage tug boat to haul Mr. Peterson’s 43 ft. wooden halibut fishing vessel to Lund, BC. The men were reported missing when they did not arrive at their destination. Extensive searches were unsuccessful. It has been speculated that the two men disappeared to start a new life.

Teeth: Other, Wide space in between the front teeth
Scar: Chest, 1 inch scar on left breast

Case reference: 2014004812.CaseDesc: Grant MOFFAT attended the Fas Gas outlet at the junction of HWY 5 and PTH 68. Here he purchased a fishing license. MOFFAT was at this location for about 20 minutes and did not seem to be in a hurry. On August 20, 2006 the vehicle belonging to MOFFAT was located on HWY 481 about 3 km west of Crane River. The vehicle had not been reported stolen. The whereabouts of MOFFAT remain unknown.

Case reference: 1996006630.CaseDesc: Adam, Mitchell and Trevor O'Brien may be in the company of their father.

Case reference: 2020011788.CaseDesc: On May 22, 1982, Ian Shim was seen for the last time when he checked into the Gran Hotel in Pereira, Columbia. He allegedly went for a hike and never returned to his room to collect his personal belongings. Ian was on a vacation in Colombia, but lived in Toronto, Ontario. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2013000021.CaseDesc: Bones of a right foot with its sock and shoe were found along a river bank.

Case reference: 2014001528.CaseDesc: On June 17, 1983, Herbert Keam stayed over at a friends house in Poplar River. Herbert asked his friend to walk with him to Norway House. His friend said no, but they walked together to Herbert's sister's house where they parted ways. Mr. Keam's sister indicated she saw Herbert that morning. He changed his clothing and left the residence without indicating what his plans were. Mr.Keam was reported missing on June 20, by his sister. Police later determined that Herbert was attempting to walk (112km's) to Norway House through the bush, however he started out in the wrong direction. The ground search utilized a police dog and various articles of clothing belonging to Herbert were found. The weather at this time was hot and muggy. Mr. Keam has not been located and his whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2020010761.CaseDesc: On September 29, 1983, at approximately 11:00am, Rudolf Jakob was seen for the last time leaving his residence in Toronto, Ontario.

Shirt: Light Blue, Dark Blue, Striped; Light blue and dark blue

Case reference: 2013000073.CaseDesc: Monique Heneault was last seen on June 4, 1986, in Montreal. Mme Heneault lived by herself in an apartment. It seems as though she left her apartment suddenly because there were left overs from her meal found on the table and counter. She had rented a chalet in Labelle, but never arrived.

Case reference: 2014004809.CaseDesc: Jeffrey Peterson was reported missing on August 7, 2006, by a family member.  Investigators were advised that Mr. Peterson's vehicle was not taken and that he does not have a history of leaving without first communicating with them. It was later determined that Mr. Peterson was last seen by a neighbor, close to his residence in Manitou, Manitoba, on the afternoon of August 5, 2006.  Numerous searches were conducted of Manitou and the surrounding area, none of which were successful.

Case reference: 2014001323.CaseDesc: Mary Kreiser was last seen September 16, 1987, at the Petro Canada Gas station in Westlock, Alberta.  She has not been heard from since October of 1987. It is believed that Mrs. Kreiser could be in Vancouver, BC area.

Case reference: 2005007699.CaseDesc: On July 9, 1986, a Caucasian male was found in the Don River, near 62 Villiers Street, in Toronto, Ontario. He was estimated to be between 25-45 years old. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 140 lbs and his length was measured at 5’11", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His teeth show heavy tartar accumulation and tobacco stain. His appendix was present and he was circumcised. He is thought to have been dead for a few days to a few weeks.

Hair: Brown, Wavy, Long, Long sideburns, a moustache which was long and curled to the side of lower lips.
Teeth: Had all of his teeth and there are some fillings as well as numerous cavities and dental abscesses.
Shoes: Canvas, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, A pair of Bauer brand shoes, made from canvas with silver stripes on the sides, size 10.
Other: Also had a pair of nail clippers; a bottle opener; and a small key on a key ring.
Watch: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Wearing a silver-coloured REMEX digital wrist watch
Socks: Wool, Blue, White, Mid-calf woolen socks which were blue on the sole and white on the top

Case reference: 2020006482.CaseDesc: On January 11, 1990, Emabit Yafru travelled from Ethiopia to Toronto, Ontario. On January 25, 1990, her husband came to Toronto and could not locate her. During the time of her disappearance, Emabit was five months pregnant.

Case reference: 2014005412.CaseDesc: On March 2, 2010, Ian Murray was seen for the last time as he left the Mental Health Unit at the Cape Breton Regional Hospital in Sydney, Nova Scotia. During the time of his disappearance, Ian was suffering from schizophrenia and had stopped taking his medication.

Case reference: 2012020134.CaseDesc: On the morning of September 4, 2002, Edward Taylor left his residence and took his vehicle to go to work. He has not been seen since. His car was found on September 7, 2002 in a service area of Porte-du-Nord, which is located on the Laurentides highway between Saint-Jérôme and Saint-Sauveur in Quebec.

Shirt: Dark Blue, Long sleeve shirt, navy blue

Case reference: 2014003888.CaseDesc: Marcel Gauthier was reported missing by a family member on September 6, 1983. Mr. Gauthier was living in an apartment in Trois-Rivieres at the time of his disappearance. He was last seen in his neighborhood on August 17, 1983.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, wedding ring on left hand
